intro: Sinocurculigo taishanica, commonly known as the Taishan arrowhead, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Iridaceae and is characterized by its distinctive arrowhead-shaped leaves. The plant produces striking blue-violet flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
